page.title: 14Horatio Bottomly.
page.content: Horatio Bottomly was born in the second half of the nineteenth century and spent some time in an orphanage in Birmingham. It was he who became responsible for the change which took place in the village of Upper Dicker. As a shorthand writer to the Lais Courts in London he leant a great deal about fraud swundling. He was responsible later for the newspaper "The Sun" the magazine John Bull and the businen paper "The Funancial Times".During the 1914-18 war he became a leading recruiting agent and it was at this time that he bought a house in Upper Dicker, and began spending his money in the village.In 1922, he was changed with defrauding the public of Â£150,000 in 10 months.He received a sentence of 7 years.Much of this money seems to he had bought was added to continually
